response.overview: From the mid-1970s onwards, alternative projects and initiatives emerged in Austria that were also referred to as the "belated 1968 movement." Communes and self-managed businesses focused on equality, cooperation, and the common good. In the cultural sphere, too, grassroots democratic and anti-capitalist projects, such as the alternative film rental service Filmladen, attracted increasing attention. In view of the multiple crises of the present, some of the concepts of that time appear visionary in retrospect and, in some cases, highly relevant again today.
response.title: Alternative Lebensformen in Österreich
